results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Presidential Election of 2024;United States Politics and Government;Content Type: Personal Profile;Politics and Government;Polls and Public Opinion;Cheney, Liz;Cheney, Dick;Hageman, Harriet;Republican Party;Cheyenne (Wyo);Wyoming
results.title: Liz Cheney Is Ready to Lose. But She’s Not Ready to Quit.
results.abstract: The Republican says her crusade to stop Donald J. Trump will continue — even if she loses her primary next week. Restoring a “very sick” G.O.P. will take years, she says, “if it can be healed.”

media.caption: Representative Liz Cheney with supporters in Cheyenne, Wyo.
media.copyright: Stephen Speranza for The New York Times

results.title: After a First Date at Popeyes, Marriage Was on the Menu
results.abstract: Sharhea Wade was ready to forget about Stevenson Boyce, whom she met on Hinge, because he twice canceled their first date. But soon after a third (successful) attempt, she was ready to marry him.

results.adx_keywords: Babies and Infants;Adoptions;Abortion;Child Abandonment;Roe v Wade (Supreme Court Decision);Safe Haven Baby Boxes (Nonprofit);Indiana;United States
results.title: Drop Box for Babies: Conservatives Promote a Way to Give Up Newborns Anonymously
results.abstract: After Roe, groups are seeking to expand safe haven laws, which allow women to surrender babies with minimal interference. But these laws pose their own problems.

media.caption: It looks like a library book drop, but it’s really a place for parents to surrender their newborns.
media.copyright: Kaiti Sullivan for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: internal-storyline-no;Inflation (Economics);Economic Conditions and Trends;Prices (Fares, Fees and Rates);Currency;US Dollar (Currency);Argentina
results.byline: By Jack Nicas, Ana Lankes and Sebastián López Brach
results.title: Think 9% Inflation Is Bad? Try 90%.
results.abstract: With the world grappling with rising prices, a tour through Argentina reveals that years of inflation can give rise to a truly bizarre economy.

media.caption: Argentina has dealt with rapidly rising prices for much of the past 50 years. People have been left with little idea of how much things should cost.

results.adx_keywords: Life-Sustaining Support Systems, Withdrawal Of;Parenting;Death and Dying;Decisions and Verdicts;Families and Family Life;Coma;Children and Childhood;Battersbee, Archie;Evans, Alfie;Gard, Charlie (2016- );Great Britain;Essex (England)
results.title: Archie Battersbee, Gravely Ill 12-Year-Old, Dies After Removal of Life Support
results.abstract: The boy’s family had made several legal appeals to keep him on a ventilator, but judges in Britain sided with doctors in finding that he had no hope of recovery.

results.adx_keywords: Swimming Pools;Real Estate and Housing (Residential);United States
results.title: Don’t Call It a Swimming Pool
results.abstract: Plunge pools have become an alternative for homeowners who want a simple, less expensive way to cool off.

media.caption: “We really wanted just a ‘cocktail pool’ that we could dip in, have some drinks, have some friends over. We just didn’t want a big pool,” said homeowner Amy Holland, whose plunge pool (seen here) did not interfere with the lengthy root system of the 100-year-old live oak on the property.
media.copyright: Katherine Squier for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Hikes and Hiking;Content Type: Service;Rescues;National Parks, Monuments and Seashores;National Park Service
results.title: Going Hiking? Don’t Forget These Safety Tips.
results.abstract: Experts say failing to alert family or friends of your plans is one of the biggest mistakes hikers make. Here are some more of their recommendations.

results.adx_keywords: Monkeypox;Vaccination and Immunization;Shortages;Smallpox;Food and Drug Administration;National Institutes of Health;United States
results.byline: By Sharon LaFraniere and Noah Weiland
results.title: Officials Wrestle With Whether to Allow New Monkeypox Vaccination Strategy
results.abstract: A new way of injecting monkeypox vaccine could stretch the nation’s supply of shots, but some experts argue that the approach has not been sufficiently studied.

media.caption: A vaccination line at the Central Harlem Sexual Health Clinic in New York on Thursday. Federal health officials are concerned that the monkeypox outbreak, which is now almost entirely confined to men who have sex with men, will spill over into the general population.
media.copyright: Victor J. Blue for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Walking;Diabetes;Exercise;Diet and Nutrition;Sugar;Research;Content Type: Service;Sports Medicine (Journal)
results.title: Just 2 Minutes of Walking After a Meal Is Surprisingly Good for You
results.abstract: A new paper suggests that it takes far less exercise than was previously thought to lower blood sugar after eating.

media.caption: A short walk can have a significant impact on blood sugar levels.

results.adx_keywords: International Relations;United States International Relations;Politics and Government;Defense and Military Forces;Xi Jinping;People's Liberation Army (China);China;Taiwan
results.byline: By Chris Buckley, Amy Chang Chien and John Liu
results.title: After China’s Military Spectacle, Options Narrow for Winning Over Taiwan
results.abstract: The exercises were designed to deter Taiwan from moving further away from Beijing, but they also indicated how few policy carrots China has.

media.caption: People lined up near the Hsinchu Military Air Base in Taiwan on Friday.
media.copyright: Lam Yik Fei for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Invasive Species;Spotted Lanternflies;Urban Areas;Insects;Parks and Recreation Department (NYC);City Council (NYC);New York City;Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas;Central Park (Manhattan, NY);Pennsylvania;New Jersey;Staten Island (NYC)
results.title: We Went on a Lanternfly-Killing Rampage. They’re Still Here.
results.abstract: The spotted lanternfly, an invasive pest that ecologists have urged the populace to squish on sight, is back, infesting the New York City area.
geo_facet: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas

media.caption: The invasive lanternfly can hurt plants and trees, but not people or animals. Scientists have encouraged people to stomp them on sight.
media.copyright: Dave Sanders for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Inflation Reduction Act of 2022;Health Insurance and Managed Care;Global Warming;Drugs (Pharmaceuticals);Prices (Fares, Fees and Rates);Medicare;United States Politics and Government;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Senate;Democratic Party
results.title: Senate Passes Climate, Health and Tax Bill, With All Republicans Opposed
results.abstract: The vote was a major victory for President Biden and Democrats, who are battling to maintain their slim House and Senate majorities in November’s midterm congressional elections.

media.caption: Democrats scaled back the legislation, which appeared dead just weeks ago, and rebranded it as the Inflation Reduction Act.
media.copyright: Tom Brenner for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Airlines and Airplanes;Anxiety and Stress;Flight Attendants;Travel and Vacations;Customs, Etiquette and Manners;Content Type: Service
results.title: 20 Years at 30,000 Feet: A Flight Attendant Answers Readers’ Questions
results.abstract: Does the cabin crew ever get scared in the air? Is there a secret flight attendant code? How do I survive a flight with my toddler? An industry insider answers.

media.caption: One of the biggest misconceptions about the job? That it’s glamorous. “One night I can be sitting by the ocean, sipping prosecco with fresh seafood, and the next I can be eating a four-day-old sandwich in my galley.”

results.title: How the Indian Action Spectacular ‘RRR’ Became a Smash in America
results.abstract: The unusual decision to rerelease the film a few weeks after its initial run has drawn enthusiastic audiences even though it’s available on Netflix.

media.caption: Set in Delhi during the early 1920s, “RRR” follows two patriotic but philosophically opposed men (Ram Charan, left, and N.T. Rama Rao Jr.) who team up to rescue a kidnapped girl from British colonial officials.

results.adx_keywords: Presidential Election of 2024;United States Politics and Government;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Trump, Donald J;Democratic Party
results.title: Hey, Joe, Don’t Give It a Go
results.abstract: Rest on your laurels, and don’t run for re-election, Mr. President.

results.adx_keywords: Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;Race and Ethnicity;Discrimination;Text Messaging;Vincent (Ala);Shelby County (Ala)
results.title: Alabama City Moves to Dissolve Police Department Over Racist Text
results.abstract: Leaders of Vincent, Ala., suspended the chief and assistant police chief after a screenshot circulated on social media showing the text message.

media.caption: The City Council in Vincent, Ala., held an emergency meeting on Thursday and took steps to disband its police department.

results.title: The Problem With Wine Bottles
results.abstract: They may be a perfect container for aging wine, but glass bottles contribute enormously to climate change.

media.caption: Cases of wine ready to be shipped from a warehouse in southern France.

results.adx_keywords: States (US);Law and Legislation;Abortion;Politics and Government;Roe v Wade (Supreme Court Decision);Cummins Inc;Eli Lilly and Company;Roche Holding AG;Salesforce.com Inc;Indiana
results.title: Major Indiana Employers Criticize State’s New Abortion Law
results.abstract: The drug company Eli Lilly said it “will be forced” to look outside the state for employment growth. The engine maker Cummins said the law will “impede our ability to attract and retain top talent.”

media.caption: Eli Lilly’s corporate headquarters in Indianapolis.

results.adx_keywords: Greenhouse Gas Emissions;Global Warming;Tax Credits, Deductions and Exemptions;United States Politics and Government;Drugs (Pharmaceuticals);United States Economy;Internal Revenue Service;Senate
results.byline: By Emily Cochrane and Lisa Friedman
results.title: What’s in the Climate, Tax and Health Care Package
results.abstract: The bill includes billions in tax credits for the production of renewable energy, drug-pricing reforms and a boost for the I.R.S.

media.caption: A petrochemicals refinery unit in Port Arthur, Texas. Legislation on the verge of Senate passage would be the largest single U.S. investment in fighting climate change.
